page.title: 05BELIEFS IN DAGENHAM
page.content: We surveyed the{beliefs}of 100 children,parents and grandparents in Dagenham. We found they had almost exactly the same number of beliefs each, although grandparents tended to lose a few. As Dagenham people age they seem to believe more in{God,}the dangers of too much sugar, Hannibal and black magic; less in regular church goers, UFOs, monsters, black cats, superstition, St. George, Hercules, ghosts, vampires and fairies. Granparents shared with children more belief than parents in Bible stories, {Father Christmas}and popular {superstitions}about broken mirrors and shoes on the table. Parents believed more often than their children in extinct animals, cannibals, evolution,
